metadata.title: CVE-2020-28588 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in the /proc/pid/syscallfunctionality of Linux Kernel 5.1 Stable and 5.4.66. More specifically,this issue has been introduced in v5.1-rc4 (commit631b7abacd02b88f4b0795c08b54ad4fc3e7c7c0) and is still present inv5.10-rc4, so itâ€™s likely that all versions in between are affected. Anattacker can read /proc/pid/syscall to trigger this vulnerability, whichleads to the kernel leaking memory contents.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
